snippet: The men taken into custody worked at a bar in Mexico City where Malcolm Shabazz was beaten during what a prosecutor called a dispute over an excessive bill.
abstract: Police in Mexico City arrest David Hernandez Cruz and Manuel Alejandro Perez de Jesus on murder and robbery charges in the beating death of Malcolm Shabazz, grandson of Malcolm X; accused worked as waiters at the Palace Club, downtown bar where Shabazz was beaten, in what the city prosecutor calls a dispute over an excessive bill.

byline.contributor: Karla Zabludovsky contributed reporting from Mexico City, and Kia Gregory from New York.

lead_paragraph: The men taken into custody worked at a bar in Mexico City where Malcolm Shabazz was beaten during what a prosecutor called a dispute over an excessive bill.

headline.seo: 2 Waiters Arrested in Killing of Malcolm X’s Grandson
headline.main: 2 Waiters Arrested in Killing of Malcolm X’s Grandson
headline.print_headline: 2 Waiters Arrested in Killing of Malcolm X’s Grandson
